meanings.definition: A person or thing that pushes.
meanings.sent1: The pushers on the playground were having fun on the swings.
meanings.sent2: The pushers of the broken-down car worked together to move it off the road.
meanings.sent3: The little robot pushers kept bumping into walls, trying to move forward.
meanings.sent4: The pushers of the heavy rock struggled against gravity to move it uphill.
meanings.sent5: The pushers of the shopping cart made sure it glided smoothly through the aisles.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism used for pushing.
meanings.sent1: The door stopper acted as a pushers to keep the door open.
meanings.sent2: The pushers on the assembly line helped move products along efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The pushers on the toy car made it zoom across the floor with ease.
meanings.sent4: The pushers on the elevator doors ensured they closed securely.
meanings.sent5: The pushers on the wheelchair allowed the user to move around independently.

meanings.definition: A person who sells illegal drugs on the street.
meanings.sent1: The police arrested the pushers for selling drugs in the alley.
meanings.sent2: The pushers were caught red-handed with bags of illegal substances.
meanings.sent3: The pushers tried to blend in with the crowd, but their shady behavior gave them away.
meanings.sent4: The pushers operated in the shadows, preying on vulnerable individuals.
meanings.sent5: The pushers' activities were finally exposed, leading to their arrest.
